Psychologically, risk-seeking is linked to traits like low childhood conscientiousness, impulsivity, and sensation-seeking, with gender differences influenced by biological factors like testosterone levels. The text integrates economic theory, behavioral psychology, and neuropsychological perspectives to explain how personality, cognition, and biology shape risk preferences.
